intro: Hieracium subasperellum, commonly known as the rough hawksbeard, is a species of flowering plant in the daisy family, Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas. The plant features a basal rosette of rough, hairy leaves and produces yellow composite flowers with ray florets. It grows to a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters and has a fibrous root system. Hieracium subasperellum is typically short-lived, completing its life cycle within a single growing season.
